item.title: The State of the Nation -- A 50-State Survey of COVID-19
item.description:
Published Materials

Data Reports

Reprots indicated with $^{*}$ indicates reports that I led, co-led or oversaw.

  • Report 12: Executive Approval Update
  • Report 13$^{*}$: Public Trust and Vaccine Acceptance
  • Report 14: Misinformation and Vaccine Acceptance
  • Report 15: Public Support for a Fifth COVID-19 Relief Package
  • Report 16: Partisan Differences in Intention to Vote by Mail
  • Report 17: COVID-19 Test Result Times
  • Report 19: Pandemic-related Factors Associated with Candidate Preferences
  • Report 20: Public Opinion Around Federal and State Reactions to COVID-19
  • Report 21$^{*}$: Most Important Problems Facing the Nation Today
  • Report 22: Executive Approval Update
  • Report 23: Depression Among Young Adults
  • Report 24: The Trajectory of Health-related Behaviors in Massachusetts
  • Report 25: Public Support for Measures Aimed at Curbing COVID-19
  • Report 26: Trajectory of Covid-19-related Behaviors
  • Report 27$^{*}$: Trajectory of Covid-19-related Behaviors in Illinois
  • Report 28: Public Support for Measures Aimed at Curbing COVID-19 in Massachusetts
  • Report 29: Election Fairness and Trust in Institutions
  • Report 30: Economic Hardships Due to the COVID-19 Pandemic
  • Report 31: Update on the Trajectory of Health-related Behaviors
  • Report 32: Update on Public Support for Measures Aimed at Curbing COVID-19
  • Report 33: Update on COVID-19 Test Turnaround Times Across the Country
  • Report 34: Update on Holiday Gatherings in December 2020
  • Report 35: Public Attitudes Towards COVID-19 Vaccines
  • Report 36: Evaluation of COVID-19 Vaccine Communication Strategies
  • Report 37: Gun Purchases During the COVID-19 Pandemic
  • Report 38: Public Perceptions of Education During the COVID-19 Pandemic
  • Report 39: Public Attitudes Towards the Storming of the Capitol Building
  • Report 40: COVID-19 Vaccine Attitudes Among Healthcare Workers
  • Report 41$^{*}$: Trajectory of Health-related Behaviors in New Jersey
  • Report 42$^{*}$: Trajectory of Health-related Behaviors in New York
  • Report 43: COVID-19 Vaccine Rates and Attitudes Among Americans
  • Report 44: Trajectory of Health-related Behaviors in Massachusetts
  • Report 45: Vaccine Hesitancy and Resistance Among Parents
  • Report 46: Executive Approval Update
  • Report 47: Update on COVID-19 Vaccine Attitudes Among Healthcare Workers
  • Report 48: Assessing the Impact of the Pause in Johnson & Johnson Vaccine Use on COVID-19 Vaccination Intent
  • Report 49: Vaccinating America’s Youth
  • Report 50: Update on the Johnson & Johnson Vaccine Pause
  • Report 51$^{*}$: Trajectory of Health-related Behaviors in California
  • Report 52: Public Support for Vaccine Requirements
  • Report 53: Public Support for Vaccine Passports
  • Report 54: Mental Health in the U.S.

item.title: Democrats and Republicans Communicate Different Moral Values through their 2016 National Convention Speeches
Levels of Conceptualization and Perceptions of Sophistication in Political Discourse
